feed.title: Data Science Africa
feed.subtitle: A Blog on Data Science Africa Events

entry.title: Data Science Africa (DSA) Uganda Network
entry.content:
Two members of the Lab are on the interim coordination team for setting up DSA Uganda network whose mission is an all-inclusive network of data scientists, enthusiasts, and organisations inspired to grow data science skills and their usage to contribute to Uganda's development aspirations, as started in the National Development Plan III (NDPIII). The network also has clear objectives and proposed activities for details visit the website: http://www.datascienceafrica.org/dsaUganda/ The network has so far organised three pre-launch events the details of follow in the next part of his annex.

Events

1st DSA Uganda Pre launch Event

Date: April 30, 2021

Event link: http://www.datascienceafrica.org/dsaUganda/events/pre-launch.html

The first pre launch event was organised around the following objectives:

  • To bring together partners working in the data science space within the country (Academia, UN, civil society, private sector (banking, insurance, fintech, utility, social security), government [local, and central];
  • To showcase local case studies and potential of data science and increase its awareness;
  • To increase interest and ownership in data science among stakeholders;
  • To Communicate the agenda of the local chapter so that the people can be aware of what is available on offer and simulate discussion on the partnership going forward.

291 individuals applied for the event, categorised in the following areas.

District distribution:

Kampala 163 Gomba 2
Wakiso 25 Luwero 1
Mbarara 14 Kibaale 1
Tororo 7 Pader 1
Lira 7 Abim 1
Busia 4 Masaka 1
Jinja 3 Lyantonde 1
Mukono 3 Moyo 1
Arua 3 Ntungamo 1
Apac 2 Adjumani 1
Kyenjojo 2 Kotido 1
Buikwe 2 Kwania 1
Gulu 2 Yumbe 1
Mpigi 2

Contributors to the first pre launch event were; Data Science Africa Org, National Planning Authority (NPA), Sunbird AI, Makerere AI Lab, Busitema AI Lab, AirQo, Umeme, MTN Uganda and Stanbic Bank.

2nd DSA Uganda Pre launch Event

Date: May 28, 2021

Event link: http://www.datascienceafrica.org/dsaUganda/events/pre-launch-2.html

The second pre launch event was themed around opportunities in, for and around data science in Uganda and attracted presentations from government institutions, policy makers, industry experts, research institutes, academic institutions, entrepreneurs, among others giving examples of opportunities for and around data science in Uganda. 346 individuals applied for the event, with applicants from 5 new districts of Mbale, Kayunga, Hoima, Soroti and Kween.

Contributors to the second pre launch event were; Ministry of ICT Uganda, NITAU, ClinicPesa, Pollicy, Innovation Village Uganda, FINCA Bank and Data Science Africa Network.

3rd DSA Uganda Pre launch Event

Date: June 25, 2021

Event link: http://www.datascienceafrica.org/dsaUganda/events/pre-launch-3.html

The third pre launch event was themed around Showcasing data science research and projects in Universities. The event was centered around student research and this is basically to encourage and foster the growth of AI research at universities through networkings and collaborations, mentorships and supervisions from experts in industry or even other universities.

Contributors to the second pre launch event were from six Universities, 5 Ugandan including; Makerere University; Uganda Technical And Management University; Gulu University; Mbarara University of Science and Technology; and Busitema University, then Rhodas University in South Africa. The presenters included two University lecturers and six students.

To date, data science Africa Uganda chapter has attracted participation from 388 students, researchers and professionals that make up the local community of the Uganda Network.

The map in Figure 2, shows participants residential/work distributions among the 15 sub regions of Uganda. Because of the 42 day lock down the launch that was due in July is now postponed to a later month, but pre-launch events organised by the regions will start this month, with the Northern region ( 4 subregions of West Nile, Achioli, Lango and Karamoja) organising this month.

Statistics from 1st and 2nd Pre-Launch Events

Figure 2: Map showing the distribution of participants in the three DSA Uganda pre-launch events

List of 28 Universities and Higher Institutions have so far participated in DSA Uganda Network events.

Africa Leadership Institute, Uganda Aptech Computer Education Busitema University
Cavendish University Clarke International University DAYSTAR University
Ernest Cook Ultrasound Research and Education Institute Gulu University ISBAT University
Islamic University In Uganda Jomo Kenyatta University of Technology Kampala International University
Kyambogo University Lira University Makerere University
Makerere University of Business School Mbarara University of Science and Technology Muni University
Namasuba college of commerce Nexus International University Nkumba university
Strathmore university Uganda Christian University Uganda Institute of ICT (UICT)
Uganda Martyrs University Uganda Technology and Management University University of Nairobi
Victoria University

Participants have so far been drawn from 13 government Ministries/ Departments/Agencies.

Ministry of Health National Water and Sewerage Corporation Uganda National Meteorological Authority
National Social Security Fund Ministry of ICT & NG National Planning Authority
National IT Authority Uganda Uganda Electricity Distribution Company Limited Uganda Broadcasting Corporation
Mulago National Referral Hospital Ministry of Public Service Uganda Registration Services Bureau
Uganda Investment Authority
entry.summary: Two members of the Lab are on the interim coordination team for setting up DSA Uganda network whose mission is an all-inclusive network of data scientists, enthusiasts, and organisations inspired to grow data science skills and their usage to contribute to Uganda's development aspirations, as started in the National Development Plan III (NDPIII). The network also has clear objectives and proposed activities for details visit the website: http://www.datascienceafrica.org/dsaUganda/ The network has so far organised three pre-launch events the details of follow in the next part of his annex.

entry.title: Data Science Africa support
entry.content:
At a glance:
396 individuals applied for the eventThe virtual event hosted by Makerere University attracted participation from East Africa and beyond as the sessions could be accessed virtually. Attendance by affiliation: academia, private sector, research institutions, government, and industry. Key DSA counterpart (s) Data Science Africa Network, Makerere University, Pulse Lab Kampala, Makerere AI Research Lab, AirQo , Facebook, Google. Sponsors: Facebook and ARM

Summer School on Machine Learning and Data Science

The summer school on machine learning and data science targeted graduate students, researchers and professionals working with large quantities of data. The sessions were spread across 4 days, 24th, 25th, 28th and 29th of July 2020.

The following 19 topics were covered;

Introduction to Python & Jupyter Environment Classification and Regression
Visualizing high dimensional data with PCA and tSNE Data Visualization : Communicating Insights and Results Effectively
Anomaly Detection MD4SG: Mechanism Design for Social Good
Introduction to Process Mining: Data Science in Action Global Challenges in Economics and Computation
Introduction to Spatial Data Analysis Deep Learning Practicals
Data for Good Computer Vision
Natural Language Processing Social Media Data Analysis
Trans-African HydroMeteorological Observatory (TAHMO) Machine Learning Systems, Streaming Data
Exploring R for Spatial Analytic Ethics in ML for Health
Data Engineering in Integrity/Security

Workshop (30th July and 1st August)

The workshops were organized around presentations of how application of data science methods are applied to problems relevant to Africa and last year in particular saw more presentations around agricultural solutions among other topics in the areas including: healthcare, social media, geospatial modelling, economic monitoring, resume writing, Internet Of Things and data science for the Sustainable Development Goals.

A panel discussion on Data Science Africa Uganda Network was conducted. The panel discussion consisted of a dialogue on the benefits of growing local data science chapters that would duplicate the activities of data science to students, researchers and professionals at a local level (by region and districts) in Uganda.

Countries that Participated

Africa (23 Countries) Benin Botswana Burkina Faso Burundi
Cameroon Congo Côte d'Ivoire Egypt
Ethiopia Ghana Kenya Libya
Malawi Morocco Nigeria Rwanda
South Africa Sudan Tanzania Togo
Zambia Zimbabwe Uganda
Outside of Africa (13 countries) Australia Bangladesh Czech Republic France
India Ireland Kuwait Poland
Russia Spain Sweden United Kingdom
United States

Achievements of DSA since 2015

Some of the achievements that DSA has attained with the Labs collaboration since 2015 include:

  • Organised week long events in six African countries including Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, Ghana, Nigeria and Ethiopia. End of this year these countries will have increased to eight with South Africa and Senegal.
  • DSA has given out research grants each worth 10,000USD to 10 research teams across Africa, after a competitive application process with more 121 applications
  • Attracted high level data science expertise from academia, private sector, civil society, governments, UN and NGO to instruct in summer schools and showcase their work in workshops - at their own cost travel and accommodation.
  • DSA has received participation from 28 African countries, these countries are shared in Figure 1.
Figure 1: Map of Africa showing countries that have citizens that have participated or benefited from DSA since 2015.
entry.summary: At a glance: 396 individuals applied for the eventThe virtual event hosted by Makerere University attracted participation from East Africa and beyond as the sessions could be accessed virtually. Attendance by affiliation: academia, private sector, research institutions, government, and industry. Key DSA counterpart (s) Data Science Africa Network, Makerere University, Pulse Lab Kampala, Makerere AI Research Lab, AirQo , Facebook, Google. Sponsors: Facebook and ARM
